intro: Draba arabisans var. superiorensis, commonly known as the alpine winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent odor. This variant is distinguished by its compact growth habit and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils at high elevations. The plant produces small, rounded leaves and has a short growing season, typically flowering in late winter or early spring. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for early pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization in harsh environments.
